means: 应急有效的，权宜之计的

sentence.Network_en: The disease was controlled by the simple expedient of not allowing anyone to leave the city.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过禁止任何人出城的简单应急办法使疾病得到了控制。

sentence.Network_en: The government found it expedient to relax censorship a little.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府发现略微放宽审查是可取的.

sentence.Network_en: It was expedient to retire gracefully.
sentence.Network_cn: 体面的让步可算是权宜之计.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 权字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 权限〖 limitsofauthority〗 权宜〖 expedient〗 权益〖 rightsandinterests〗.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... （impede 妨碍+ ) expedient a 方便的；权宜的 ) pediatrist n 儿科医生.
雅思词汇词根+联想记忆法 ... expand v. (使)扩大,展开;膨胀 expedient a. 有用的,有利的; expedition n. 远征,探险(队),考察(队).
英语构词法记忆单词研究 ... expediency 权宜,利害 expedient 得当,便利的 expedition 迅速(的行动),探险.

list.abs: 佛教名称中英文对照_哲学家_新浪博客 ... expedient means 方便 expedient wisdom 权智 explain 说.
expectingly 期待地expedient rationality 方便的推理experience 经验
expanded polystyrene 泡沬塑料；发泡胶expedient connection 非法接驳排污渠；权宜的接驳渠道exploitation 开采
expediency =expedienceexpedient measure 简便措施expedient 便利的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin expedient- 'extricating, putting in order', from the verb expedire (see expedite). The original sense was neutral; the depreciatory sense, implying disregard of moral considerations, dates from the late 18th cent

entry.def: An expedient is an action that achieves a particular purpose, but may not be morally right.

example.ex: Surgical waiting lists were reduced by the simple expedient of striking off all patients awaiting varicose vein operations...
example.tran: 采取了将所有等待进行静脉曲张手术的病人从名单上删除的简单做法，这一权宜之计使得外科手术等待名单得以缩减。

example.ex: The story was a temporary expedient.
example.tran: 这个借口是临时的应急之法。

entry.tran: 有利的;方便的;权宜之计的
entry.def: If it is expedient to do something, it is useful or convenient to do it, even though it may not be morally right.

example.ex: Governments frequently ignore human rights abuses in other countries if it is politically expedient to do so.
example.tran: 如果在政治上对自己有利，各国政府经常忽视其他国家侵犯人权的行为。

means.word_mean: 1. a means to an end; not necessarily a principled or ethical one

sentences.sentence: "was merciful only when mercy was expedient"
"in the circumstances it was expedient to express loyalty"

auth_sentence.content: The most expedient settlements for a trading country.
auth_sentence.res_content: The most expedient settlements for a trading country.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The most expedient settlements for a trading country.

auth_sentence.content: Chalabi claimed that his relationship with Tehran was purely expedient.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chalabi claimed that his relationship with Tehran was purely expedient.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chalabi claimed that his relationship with Tehran was purely expedient.

auth_sentence.content: English trade barriers had been overcome by the simple expedient of smuggling.
auth_sentence.res_content: English trade barriers had been overcome by the simple expedient of smuggling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: English trade barriers had been overcome by the simple expedient of smuggling.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =foot,表示"足,脚"; 2. =child/education,表示"儿童"; 3. 引申为"教育"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+ped足,脚+ient→能把脚跨出去→方便
expedite[v.使加速,促进]+ious……的→adj.迅速的,敏捷的
ped足,脚+estrian……的人→用脚走路的人
bi两+ped足,脚→n.两足动物
centi一百+ped足,脚+e→一百只脚的动物
ex出+ped足,脚+ient→能把脚跨出去→方便
expedite[v.使加速,促进]+ion→n.远征[队],探险[队]
impedi=impede[v.妨碍]+ment物→n.妨碍,阻碍物
ped足,脚+al→n.踏板 v.踩踏板,骑自行车
ped足,脚+estrian……的人→用脚走路的人
pod=ped足,脚+iatrist专家→n.足病医生
quadru四+ped足,脚→n.四足动物
ped教育+agog引导+y→引导教学→教学法
ped教育+ant人→受过教育的人→书呆子
pedant[n.迂腐之人,书呆子]+ry状态,性质→n.迂腐
ped儿童+istiatr专家,医生→n.儿科医师
ped儿童+ology学科→n.儿科学
ex出+ped足,脚+ite促成→把脚跨出去→加快
im进入+ped足,脚+e→把脚放进去→妨碍
ped足,脚+al→n.踏板 v.踩踏板,骑自行车
